Book Length

Palgrave's target length is 75,000 words. We can negotiate with them on this, but to do so on the basis of more than mere guesswork, let's estimate where we stand here.

Author(s) Paper Est. Length
(Words)
Abel Systems So Perfect That No One Has to Be Good 3300
Blake The Mystery of Human Existence 4000
Brommage Who’s a Good Dogma?!?: Perspectives on Quine’s Critique of Analyticity 3500
Callahan What the Tortoise Said to Achilles 3000
Coats Michael Oakeshott: Rationalism Is Irrational 3500
Cowen The Errors of Constructivist Rationalism 5000
Federici Eric Voegelin: Don't Immanentize the Eschaton 5500
Ferrell Berlin and Moral Monism 4000
Garrison The Hammer Goes to Monticello 5000
Holston The Metaphysical Historicism of Hans-Georg Gadamer 3500
Hörcher "The Age of Chivalry is Gone." Edmund Burke's Account of the Loss of Virtue, and of the Birth of Modern Sophistry 3300
Ikeda Jane Jacobs: Critiquing the Rationalist City 3300
Knepper Gabriel Marcel: Mystery and Problem, Being and Having 5000
Kos G.K. Chesterton 3500
Lowney Michael Polanyi: A Scientist Against Scientism 3500
Mahoney Blaise Pascal 3500
Marsh / Powell Fyodor Dostoevsky 4000
McIntyre Modern Moral Philosophy, Virtue, and Pluralism: MacIntyre and the Quest for the Human Telos 4500
Sheahan C.S. Lewis: The Abolition of Man 3500
Simmons The Limiting Character of the Scientific Method 5000
Smith / Jin The Uneasy Friendship Between Reason and Freedom 3500
Sportiello Ludwig Wittgenstein: Forms of Life 3500
Wyllie Kierkegaard’s Critique of Political Rationalism 4500
All Entire book 90,900
